awd_titl_txt: Algorithms for Distributed, Fault-Tolerant and Secure,      Computing and for Routing and Control in Parallel Computers
awd_abstract_narration: The work on the Information Dispersal Algorithm (IDA) makes it                  possible to store and route information in distributed and parallel             systems so as to achieve highly fault tolerant and space-time                   efficient performance.  Applications of this method will be developed,          in particular to routing in asynchronous parallel computers and to              storage of information in disk arrays.                                                                                                                          There now exist, non-cryptographic, secure (i.e. secret and resistant           to malicious adversaries) distributed computing protocols.  These               methods will be applied to extend the ITOSS (Integrated Toolkit for             Operating System Security) to the distributed system environment so as          to achieve system security based on distributed authority.  IDA brings          about an improvement in routing of data through computation on that             data.  This suggests a study of the possible tradeoffs between                  computation and switching of data.                                                                                                                              Randomized algorithms will continue to be a major tool in the study of          the above questions.
